Format values as times

Source: R/format_data.R
fmt_time.Rd

Format values as times

fmt_time(data, columns, rows = NULL, time_style)

Arguments

data

a table object that is created using the gt() function.
columns

the column names to format.
rows

optional rows to format. Not providing any value results in all rows in columns being formatted.
time_style

the time style to use. Supply a number (from 1 to 5) that corresponds to the preferred time style. Use info_time_style() to see the different numbered and named time presets.

See also

Other data formatting functions: fmt_currency, fmt_datetime, fmt_date, fmt_missing, fmt_number, fmt_passthrough, fmt_percent, fmt_scientific, fmt

Examples

library(tidyverse)

# Create a tibble with a column
# that contains 24-hour time strings
data_tbl <-
  dplyr::tribble(
    ~time,
    "12:35:23",
    "15:01:34",
    "09:45:23",
    "01:32:00")

# Create a table object using this
# dataset and format the `time`
# column with `time_style` '3'
gt(data_tbl) %>%
  fmt_time(
    columns = vars(time),
    time_style = 3)
#> <style>/* gt compiled CSS file */
